application.doc: Retrieve a specific API protection definition

param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

param.name: definition_id
param.doc: The system-assigned API protection definition ID value.

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieve a specific API protection definition
method.doc: To retrieve information on a specific API protection definition, issue an HTTP GET command on the definitions resource URI.

param.name: Authorization: Basic
param.doc: Basic authentication header.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting.

param.name: tcmBehavior
param.doc: Identifies the Trusted Client Manager behavior concerning trusted clients and consent. "ALWAYS_PROMPT" indicates the user is prompted to provide their consent for a new authorization grant. "NEVER_PROMPT" indicates implicit consent is allowed, whereby the user is never shown a consent to authorize prompt. "PROMPT_ONCE_AND_REMEMBER" indicates that the Trusted Client Manager stores consent decisions when consent is granted, and that the user is prompted for consent when a previous consent for the client with the particular scope is not already stored.

param.name: grantTypes
param.doc: A list of supported authorization grant types. Valid values are "AUTHORIZATION_CODE", "RESOURCE_OWNER_PASSWORD_CREDENTIALS", "CLIENT_CREDENTIALS", "IMPLICIT_GRANT", "SAML_BEARER", "JWT_BEARER", and "DEVICE".

param.name: pinPolicyEnabled
param.doc: True if the refresh token will be further protected with a PIN provided by the API protection client. Applicable when issueRefreshToken is true.

param.name: maxAuthorizationGrantLifetime
param.doc: The maximum duration of a grant, in seconds, where the resource owner authorized the client to access the protected resource. When this lifetime expires, the resource owner must reauthorize the client to obtain an authorization grant to access the protected resource.

param.name: refreshTokenLength
param.doc: Length (characters) of the refresh token.

param.name: issueRefreshToken
param.doc: True if a refresh token should be issued to the client. This option is only applicable when grantTypes includes "AUTHORIZATION_CODE" or "RESOURCE_OWNER_PASSWORD_CREDENTIALS".

param.name: tokenCharSet
param.doc: String of characters that can be used to generate tokens.

param.name: lastmodified
param.doc: Specifies the date and time stamp this API protection definition was last modified. The String is formatted as a JSON date which has the same format as the ISO-8601 standard: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ.

param.name: datecreated
param.doc: Specifies the date and time stamp this API protection definition was created. The String is formatted as a JSON date which has the same format as the ISO-8601 standard: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ.

param.name: enforceSingleUseAuthorizationGrant
param.doc: True if all tokens of the authorization grant are revoked after an access token is validated.

param.name: mappingRules
param.doc: Array of mapping rule information entries providing the mapping rule ID value for the pre-token generation and post-token generation mapping rules for this API protection definition.

param.name: authorizationCodeLength
param.doc: Length (characters) of the authorization code. This field is applicable when grantTypes includes "AUTHORIZATION_CODE".

param.name: id
param.doc: Internally assigned ID value of this API protection definition.

param.name: accessPolicyId
param.doc: The id of access policy assigned to this definition.

param.name: enforceSingleAccessTokenPerGrant
param.doc: True if previously granted access tokens are revoked after a new access token is generated by presenting the refresh token to the authorization server. Applicable if issueRefreshToken is true.

param.name: enableMultipleRefreshTokensForFaultTolerance
param.doc: True if multiple refresh tokens are stored so that the old refresh token is valid until the new refresh token is successfully delivered. Applicable if issueRefreshToken is true.

param.name: accessTokenLifetime
param.doc: Validity of the access token, in seconds. When this lifetime expires, the client cannot use the current access token to access the protected resource.

param.name: description
param.doc: A description of the API protection definition.

param.name: name
param.doc: A unique name for the API protection definition.

param.name: accessTokenLength
param.doc: Length (characters) of the access token.

param.name: pinLength
param.doc: The length (characters) of a PIN. Applicable when pinPolicyEnabled is true.

param.name: authorizationCodeLifetime
param.doc: Validity period, in seconds, of the authorization code. This field is applicable when grantTypes includes "AUTHORIZATION_CODE".

param.name: oidc
param.doc: The OIDC configuration for this API protection definition.

param.name: attributeSources
param.doc: Array of configured attribute sources to use in id_token generation and userinfo requests.

param.name: id
param.doc: Internally assigned ID value of the mapping rule assigned to the API protection definition.

param.name: type
param.doc: Specifies the type of mapping rule.

param.name: enabled
param.doc: If OpenID Connect is enabled for this definition.

param.name: iss
param.doc: The issuer identifier of this definition. Should have the prefix 'https://'.

param.name: poc
param.doc: The Point of Contact URL for this definition, must be a valid URL. Should include the junction portion.

param.name: lifetime
param.doc: The lifetime of the id_tokens issued

param.name: alg
param.doc: The signing algorithm for the JWT, can be any combination of the following: HS/ES/RS 256/384/512, Eg RS256. If HS* signing is used, clients MUST have a client secret to form JWTs. Default value is 'RS256'

param.name: db
param.doc: The database containing the signing key for RS/ES signing methods.

param.name: cert
param.doc: The certificate label of the signing key for RS/ES signing methods.

param.name: enc
param.doc: JWT encrption config.

param.name: includeIssInAuthResp
param.doc: If ISS should included in the authorization response.

param.name: dynamicClients
param.doc: Whether or not the client registration endpoint will be enabled for this definition. If not presented in an update or create then a value of 'false' will be used.

param.name: issueSecret
param.doc: Whether or not a client secret will be issued to dynamic clients. When this is set to true, a client secret will only be issued to a client registration request which is made by an authenticated user. If not presented in an update or create then a value of 'false' will be used.

param.name: oidcCompliant
param.doc: Whether or not the definition should be strictly OIDC Compliant.

param.name: fapiCompliant
param.doc: Whether or not the definition should be strictly FAPI Compliant. Setting this to true will automatically set OIDC Compliant to true.

param.name: attributeName
param.doc: Name the attribute should be exposed as.

param.name: attributeSourceId
param.doc: Reference to the attribute source which should be used to retrieve the value.

param.name: enabled
param.doc: is encryption enabled for this definition.

param.name: alg
param.doc: The key agreement algorithm for encryption. See LMI for choices. Default value is 'RSA-OAEP-256'.

param.name: enc
param.doc: The encryption algorithm. Default value is 'A128CBC-HS256'.

response.doc: Bad Request. There is a problem with the request. The JSON result describes the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting.

param.name: result
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: Not Found. The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting.

param.name: result
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting.

param.name: result
param.doc: The error message.
